info.title: TamTam Bot API
info.description:
# About Bot API allows bots to interact with TamTam. Methods are called by sending HTTPS requests to [botapi.tamtam.chat](https://botapi.tamtam.chat) domain. Bots are third-party applications that use TamTam features. A bot can legitimately take part in a conversation. It can be achieved through HTTP requests to the TamTam Bot API. ## Features TamTam bots of the current version are able to: - Communicate with users and respond to requests - Recommend users complete actions via programmed buttons - Request personal data from users (name, short reference, phone number) We'll keep working on expanding bot capabilities in the future. ## Examples Bots can be used for the following purposes: - Providing support, answering frequently asked questions - Sending typical information - Voting - Likes/dislikes - Following external links - Forwarding a user to a chat/channel ## @PrimeBot We are beta testing bots in TamTam now. To become a beta tester, please, contact us on **[@support](https://tt.me/support)** or [team@tamtam.chat](mailto:team@tamtam.chat). We'll give you access to [PrimeBot](https://tt.me/primebot), all TamTam bots creator. It will help you choose a unique short name for a bot and fill in its full name and description. With PrimeBot you can create bots as well as edit and delete them and browse information on bots you have created. #### [PrimeBot](https://tt.me/primebot) commands: `/start` — start a dialog with a bot
`/create` — create a bot, assign the unique short name to it (from 4 to 64 characters)
`/set_name [name]` — assign a short or full name to the bot (up to 200 characters)
`/set_description [description]` — enter the description for the bot profile (up to 400 characters)
`/set_picture [URL]` — enter the URL of bot's picture
`/delete [username]` — delete the bot
`/list` — show the list of all bots
`/get_token` — obtain a token for a bot
`/revoke` — request a new token
`/help` — help
## Authentification A token is given to you by [PrimeBot](https://tt.me/primebot) after you have created a bot. If [Terms and Conditions of TamTam usage](https://team.tamtam.chat/en/terms/) have been violated, the TamTam administration may withdraw tokens by aborting user sessions. If your token has been compromised, you can request a new one by sending a `/revoke` command to **[PrimeBot](https://tt.me/primebot)**. In all subsequent requests to the Bot API, you must pass the received token as an `access_token` parameter to the HTTP request. ## HTTP verbs `GET` — getting resources, parameters are transmitted via URL
`POST` — creation of resources (for example, sending new messages)
`PUT` — editing resources
`DELETE` — deleting resources
`PATCH` — patching resources ## HTTP response codes `200` — successful operation
`400` — invalid request
`401` — authentication error
`404` — resource not found
`405` — method not allowed
`429` — the number of requests is exceeded
`503` — service unavailable
## Resources format For content requests (PUT and POST) and responses, the API uses the JSON format. All strings are UTF-8 encoded. Date/time fields are represented as the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since 00:00 January 1, 1970 in the long format. To get it, you can simply multiply the UNIX timestamp by 1000. All date/time fields have a UTC timezone. ## Error responses In case of an error, the API returns a response with the corresponding HTTP code and JSON with the following fields:
`code` - the string with the error key
`message` - a string describing the error
For example: ```bash > http https://botapi.tamtam.chat/chats?access_token={EXAMPLE_TOKEN} HTTP / 1.1 403 Forbidden Cache-Control: no-cache Connection: Keep-Alive Content-Length: 57 Content-Type: application / json; charset = utf-8 Set-Cookie: web_ui_lang = ru; Path = /; Domain = .tamtam.chat; Expires = 2019-03-24T11: 45: 36.500Z { "code": "verify.token", "message": "Invalid access_token" } ``` ## Receiving Notifications TamTam Bot API supports 2 options of receiving notifications on new dialog events for bots: - Push notifications via WebHook. To receive data via WebHook, you'll have to use the [/subscribe](https://dev.tamtam.chat/#operation/subscribe) method; - Notifications upon request via long polling All data can be received via long polling by default after creating the bot Both methods **cannot** be used simultaneously. Refer to the response schema of [/updates](https://dev.tamtam.chat/#operation/getUpdates) method to check all available types of updates. ## Message buttons You can program buttons for users answering a bot. TamTam supports the following types of buttons:
`callback` — sends a notification to a bot (via WebHook or long polling)
`link` — makes a user to follow a link
`message` — sends a pre-formed message to the bot as a regular text message
`request_contact` — requests the user permission to access contact information (phone number, short link, email)
You may also send a message with an [InlineKeyboard]() type attachment to start creating buttons. When the user presses a button, the bot receives the answer with filled callback field. It is recommended to edit that message so the user can receive updated buttons. ## Versioning API models and interface may change over time. To make sure your bot will get the right info, we strongly recommend adding API version number to each request. You can add it as `v` parameter to each HTTP-request. For instance, `v=0.1.2`. To specify the data model version you are getting through WebHook subscription, use the `version` property in the request body of the [subscribe](https://dev.tamtam.chat/#operation/subscribe) request. ## Libraries We have created [Java library](https://github.com/tamtam-chat/tamtam-bot-api) to make using API easier. ## Changelog ##### Version 0.1.3 - Added method to [delete](https://dev.tamtam.chat/#operation/deleteMessages) messages - Added ability to [get](https://dev.tamtam.chat/#operation/getMessages) particular messages by ID - Added `is_admin` flag to `ChatMember` - Added `message` property to `MessageCallbackUpdate` - Renamed property `message` to `body` for `Message` schema - Added reusable `token` to `PhotoAttachment`. It allows to attach the same photo more than once.

get.description: Returns info about current bot. Current bot can be identified by access token. Method returns bot identifier, name and avatar (if any).

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

get.description: Returns information about chats that bot participated in: a result list and marker points to the next page.

parameters.description: Points to next data page. `null` for the first page
parameters.name: marker

patch.description: Edits chat info: title, icon, etc…

200.description: If success, returns updated chat object

get.description: Returns chat membership info for current bot

200.description: Returns members list and pointer to the next data page

post.description: Adds members to chat. Additional permissions may require.

delete.description: Removes member from chat. Additional permissions may require.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: User id to remove from chat

get.description: In case your bot gets data via WebHook, the method returns list of all subscriptions.

post.description: Subscribes bot to receive updates via WebHook. After calling this method, the bot will receive notifications about new events in chat rooms at the specified URL

delete.description: Unsubscribes bot from receiving updates via WebHook. After calling the method, the bot stops receiving notifications about new events. Notification via the long-poll API becomes available for the bot

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL to remove from WebHook subscriptions

post.description:
Returns the URL for the subsequent file upload.

For example, you can upload it via curl:
```
curl -i -X POST 
    -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" 
    -F "data=@movie.mp4" "%UPLOAD_URL%"
```

Two types of an upload are supported: 
- single request upload (multipart request)
- and resumable upload.
 
##### Multipart upload

This type of upload is a simpler one but it is less reliable and agile. If a `Content-Type`: multipart/form-data header is passed in a request our service indicates upload type as a simple single request upload. 
This type of an upload has some restrictions: 
- Max. file size - 2 Gb 
- Only one file per request can be uploaded
- No possibility to restart stopped / failed upload

##### Resumable upload
If `Content-Type` header value is not equal to `multipart/form-data` our service indicated upload type as a resumable upload.
With a `Content-Range` header current file chunk range and complete file size can be passed. If a network error has happened or upload was stopped you can continue to upload a file from the last successfully uploaded file chunk. You can request the last known byte of uploaded file from server and continue to upload a file. 

##### Get upload status
To GET an upload status you simply need to perform HTTP-GET request to a file upload URL. Our service will respond with current upload status, complete file size and last known uploaded byte. This data can be used to complete stopped upload if something went wrong. If `REQUESTED_RANGE_NOT_SATISFIABLE` or `INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR` status was returned it is a good point to try to restart an upload

parameters.description: Uploaded file type: photo, audio, video, file
parameters.name: type

get.description: Returns messages in chat: result page and marker referencing to the next page. Messages traversed in reverse direction so the latest message in chat will be first in result array. Therefore if you use `from` and `to` parameters, `to` must be **less than** `from`

parameters.description: Chat identifier to get messages in chat
parameters.name: chat_id

parameters.description: Messages ids you want to get
parameters.name: message_ids
count
parameters.description: Maximum amount of messages in response

403.description: This exception happens when user suspended bot or it doesn't have access to chat

post.description:
Sends a message to a chat. As a result for this method new message identifier returns.
### Attaching media
Attaching media to messages is a three-step process.

At first step, you should [obtain a URL to upload](#operation/getUploadUrl) your media files.

At the second, you should upload binary of appropriate format to URL you obtained at the previous step. See [upload](https://dev.tamtam.chat/#operation/getUploadUrl) section for details.

Finally, if the upload process was successful, you will receive JSON-object in a response body.  Use this object to create attachment. Construct an object with two properties: 
- `type` with the value set to appropriate media type 
- and `payload` filled with the JSON you've got. 

For example, you can attach a video to message this way:

1. Get URL to upload. Execute following:
```shell
curl -X POST \
  'https://botapi.tamtam.chat/uploads?access_token=%access_token%&type=video'
```
As the result it will return URL for the next step.
```json
{
    "url": "http://vu.mycdn.me/upload.do…"
}
```


2. Use this url to upload your binary: 
```shell
curl -i -X POST 
    -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" 
    -F "data=@movie.mp4" "http://vu.mycdn.me/upload.do…"
```
As the result it will return JSON you can attach to message:
```json
{
    "id": 1234567890
}
```
3. Send message with attach:
```json
{
	"text": "Message with video",
	"attachments": [
		{
			"type": "video",
			"payload": {
			    "id": 1173574260020
			}
		}
	]
}
```

**Important notice**:

It may take time for the server to process your file (audio/video or any binary). While a file is not processed you can't attach it. It means the last step will fail with `503` error. Try to send a message again until you'll get a successful result.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Fill this paramter if you want to send message to user

parameters.name: chat_id
parameters.description: Fill this if you send message to chat

put.description: Updated message should be sent as `NewMessageBody` in a request body. In case `attachments` field is `null`, the current message attachments won’t be changed. In case of sending an empty list in this field, all attachments will be deleted.

delete.description: Deletes message in a dialog or in a chat if bot has permission to delete messages.

post.description: This method should be called to send an answer after a user has clicked the button. The answer may be an updated message or a one-time user notification.

parameters.name: callback_id
parameters.description: Identifies a button clicked by user. Bot receives this identifier after user pressed button as part of `MessageCallbackUpdate`

get.description: You can use this method for getting updates in case your bot is not subscribed to WebHook. The method based on long polling.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximim number of updates to be retrieved.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Timeout in seconds for long polling.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description: Identifier of first requested update. Pass `null` to get updates you didn't get yet.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Update types your bot want to receive.

api_key.name: access_token
api_key.description: Bot API token. Get it using https://tt.me/PrimeBot

Unauthorized.description: Authorization Error. No `access_token` provided or token is invalid

Forbidden.description: Access error. You don't have permissions to access this resource

username.description: Unique public user name. Can be `null` if user is not accessible or it is not set

full_avatar_url.description: URL of avatar of a bigger size

type.description: Type of chat. One of: dialog, chat, channel

status.description:
Chat status. One of:
 - active: bot is active member of chat
 - removed: bot was kicked
 - left: bot intentionally left chat
 - closed: chat was closed

title.description: Visible title of chat. Can be null for dialogs

last_event_time.description: Time of last event occured in chat

participants_count.description: Number of people in chat. Always 2 for `dialog` chat type

owner_id.description: Identifier of chat owner. Visible only for chat admins

participants.description: Participants in chat with time of last activity. Can be *null* when you request list of chats. Visible for chat admins only

is_public.description: Is current chat publicly available. Always `false` for dialogs

link.description: Link on chat if it is public

ChatType.description: Type of chat. Dialog (one-on-one), chat or channel

marker.description: Reference to the next page of requested chats

permissions.description: Permissions in chat if member is admin. `null` otherwise

members.description: Participants in chat with time of last activity. Visible only for chat admins

marker.description: Pointer to the next data page

Recipient.description: New message recepient. Could be user or chat

user_id.description: User identifier, if message was sent to user

recipient.description: Message recipient. Could be user or chat

body.description: Body of created message. Text + attachments. Could be null if message contains only forwarded message.

seq.description: Sequence identifier of message in chat

attachments.description: Message attachments. Could be one of `Attachment` type. See description of this schema

reply_to.description: In case this message is repled to, it is the unique identifier of the replied message

attachments.description: Message attachments. See `AttachmentRequest` and it's inheritors for full information.

notify.description: If false, chat participants wouldn't be notified

chat_id.description: Chat where message was originally posted

Keyboard.description: Keyboard is two-dimension array of buttons

intent.description: Intent of button. Affects clients representation.

CallbackButton.description: After pressing this type of button client sends to server payload it contains

LinkButton.description: After pressing this type of button user follows the link it contains

RequestContactButton.description: After pressing this type of button client sends new message with attachment of curent user contact

RequestGeoLocationButton.description: After pressing this type of button client sends new message with attachment of current user geo location

quick.description: If *true*, sends location without asking user's confirmation

AttachmentRequest.description: Request to attach some data to message

PhotoAttachmentRequestPayload.description: Request to attach image. All fields are mutually exclusive.

url.description: If specified, given URL will be attached to message as image

photos.description: Tokens were obtained after uploading images

PhotoTokens.description: This is information you will recieve as soon as an image uploaded

VideoAttachmentRequest.description: Request to attach video to message

AudioAttachmentRequest.description: Request to attach audio to message. MUST be the only attachment in message

UploadedInfo.description: This is information you will recieve as soon as audio/video is uploaded

FileAttachmentRequest.description: Request to attach file to message. MUST be the only attachment in message

UploadedFileInfo.description: This is information you will recieve as soon as a file is uploaded

ContactAttachmentRequest.description: Request to attach contact card to message. MUST be the only attachment in message

vcfInfo.description: Full information about contact in VCF format

StickerAttachmentRequest.description: Request to attach sticker. MUST be the only attachment request in message

InlineKeyboardAttachmentRequest.description: Request to attach keyboard to message

LocationAttachmentRequest.description: Request to attach keyboard to message

SubscriptionRequestBody.description: Request to set up WebHook subscription

url.description: URL of HTTP(S)-endpoint of your bot

update_types.description: List of update types your bot want to receive. See `Update` object for a complete list of types

version.description: Version of API. Affects model representation

Callback.description: Object sent to bot when user presses button

timestamp.description: Unix-time when user pressed the button

CallbackAnswer.description: Send this object when your bot wants to react to when a button is pressed

message.description: Fill this if you want to modify current message

notification.description: Fill this if you just want to send one-time notification to user

Error.description: Server returns this if there was an exception to your request

UploadEndpoint.description: Endpoint you should upload to your binaries

SenderAction.description: Different actions to send to chat members

UpdateList.description: List of all updates in chats your bot participated in

marker.description: Pointer to the next data page

Update.description: `Update` object repsesents different types of events that happened in chat. See its inheritors

MessageCallbackUpdate.description: You will get this `update` as soon as user presses button

message.description: Original message containing inline keyboard. Can be `null` in case it had been deleted by the moment a bot got this update.

MessageCreatedUpdate.description: You will get this `update` as soon as message is created

BotAddedToChatUpdate.description: You will receive this update when bot has been added to chat

chat_id.description: Chat id where bot was added

user_id.description: User id who added bot to chat

BotRemovedFromChatUpdate.description: You will receive this update when bot has been removed from chat

user_id.description: User id who removed bot from chat

UserAddedToChatUpdate.description: You will receive this update when user has been added to chat where bot is administrator

chat_id.description: Chat identifier where event has occured

inviter_id.description: User who added user to chat

UserRemovedFromChatUpdate.description: You will receive this update when user has been removed from chat where bot is administrator

chat_id.description: Chat identifier where event has occured

admin_id.description: Administrator who removed user from chat

BotStartedUpdate.description: Bot gets this type of update as soon as user pressed `Start` button

chat_id.description: Dialog identifier where event has occurred

ChatTitleChangedUpdate.description: Bot gets this type of update as soon as title has been changed in chat

chat_id.description: Chat identifier where event has occurred
